title: WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION
content:
WHO (World Health Organisation) is a specialized agency of the United Nations, which acts as an organization responsible for international public health. Fighting illnesses throughout the globe, dealing with health and sanitation issues, as well as dispatching medical teams to combat epidemics defines the agency. It was established on 7 April 1948.

Within this committee, participants are expected to take their positions as Delegates of the World Health Organisation, following their assignments. The committee members are expected to focus on their agenda item to eradicate polio, an infectious disease, from the face of the earth. Many cases appeared once again in the late 1940s, and now we have to face impending epidemics as it spreads rapidly.

A recently formed institution, will it find the solutions that humanity desperately needs, or will it be unable to carry out the burden of those who are devastated by many diseases?
